TopicTitle: Is warping supposed to change the outcome of a mission?

Articles.Content:
If I warp the first stage of my rocket (which takes a while), my outer solid fuel engines (thumpers) start violently wobbling, and they eventually become detached. Is warping supposed to change the outcome of a mission like that? Because if I don't warp it, it runs smoothly. You can view my rocket uploaded to Steam here.

 

Thanks in advance for your responses.

Are you warping while still in the atmosphere?  If you are, it's using physics warp, which can cause ships to become unstable, depending on their design.  It even warns you about using it when you use it.

If it's standard warp in space, can you record a video of it happening?  Also, are you using any mods?

Time warp exacerbates any physics issues.

It's actually a great way to stress test your creations. Lol.

Anyways to answer the question; Yes. That's how it is, you aren't doing anything wrong per se, but some autostruts would likely solve your issue.

2 hours ago, Geonovast said:

Are you warping while still in the atmosphere?  If you are, it's using physics warp, which can cause ships to become unstable, depending on their design.  It even warns you about using it when you use it.

If it's standard warp in space, can you record a video of it happening?  Also, are you using any mods?

Ah. That would be it! Thanks friend.
